meanings.definition: The outer layer of an organ or body structure.
meanings.sent1: The cortices of the tree bark protect the inner layers.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the cortices of the brain to understand its functions.
meanings.sent3: The cortices of the fruit were so tough, it was like trying to peel a rock!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled in the cortices of her mind, like a whirlpool.
meanings.sent5: The cortices of the flower petals were delicate and colorful.

meanings.sent1: They examined the cortices of the brain to find abnormalities.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the cortices of various species for comparison.
meanings.sent3: The cortices of the city were bustling with activity.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, galaxies are like the cortices of a cosmic brain.
meanings.sent5: The cortices of the fabric showed intricate patterns and designs.
